description: News, updates and information for the Bailiwick of Guernsey.
title: Guernsey news and updates 26-30 October
title_page: Guernsey news and updates 26-30 October - BBC News
maintext:
The Committee for Education Sport and Culture (ESC) has issued a call to find two non-voting members to work with elected members.
They will be able to work on all areas of committee responsibility, but cannot vote on decisions.
ESC President Andrea Dudley-Owen said they were "keen to hear" from people who are passionate and have the "necessary commitment" to help fulfil the committee's responsibilities.
She said: "While no specific qualifications are needed and we would welcome approaches from people from a variety of backgrounds and experience, we would particularly like to hear from people with experience in governance or representing employee groups."
ESC's responsibilities include the education, apprenticeships, sport, leisure and recreation, libraries, museums, galleries and heritage, archaeology, the arts, Island Archives and civic celebrations such as Liberation Day.
Anyone interested in a seat on the committee as a non-voting member should contact Esther Ingrouille by email at esther.ingrouille@gov.gg .
